page.title: 04Eaton Sand Quarry,Congleton
page.content: It is situated two miles north of {Congleton. }Eleven years ago this land was farmland. This 90 ft.deep quarry was opened in 1974. It was owned by Hinkleys and was later taken over by Tilcon in 1980. In 1984 it changed hands again this time to B.T.R. It is the largest quarry in Europe. Eighty men work here. This may not seem a lot but it only takes one man to operate the computerised machinery which controls 380 acres by pressing a few buttons. Most of the employees are lorry drivers who have 55 wagons to drive. The sand is pumped from water which is 60 ft.deep, then it is cleaned and left to dry. 300 tons of sand per hour is produced from the quarry. It is used for anything from foundry work to face powder.
